meanings.definition: To renounce or relinquish a throne, power, responsibility, or right.
meanings.sent1: The king was abdicating his throne to his son.
meanings.sent2: She was abdicating her role as team captain.
meanings.sent3: The cat was abdicating its duty as a mouse catcher.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be abdicating its position in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The student abdicating his homework was like giving up his chance to learn.

meanings.definition: To give up or surrender a position of authority or duty.
meanings.sent1: The manager was abdicating his leadership role.
meanings.sent2: They were abdicating their responsibility to protect the environment.
meanings.sent3: The clown abdicating his role as entertainer was quite a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The river abdicating its course during the flood was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The soldier abdicating his post put the entire mission at risk.
